This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=GEOPHYSICS.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-11T16:27:50Z Sheila Peacock 2015-03-11T16:27:41+00:00 2015-03-11T16:27:41+00:00 Fwd: Notice of meeting on shale geomechanics https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;192b0d88.1503 Dear all,<br><br>This conference, following the GeolSoc's "Year of Mud" theme,<br>is of interest to geophysicists working on rock properties.<br><br>I asked Ernie Rutter if the organisers would accept papers<br>on geomagnetic properties, since that was not mentioned<br>in the call below, and he said that there were no<br>restrictions on the scope I suggest that anyone who has a<br>specific idea of a paper they would like to offer in that field,<br>they discuss it with Ernie. [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-03-10T08:05:18+00:00 2015-03-10T08:05:18+00:00 3 job vacancies at ISC https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;961b77fe.1503 Dear All,<br><br>Dmitry Storchak, director of the International Seismological<br>Centre (ISC) asked me to draw your attention to the following three<br>job vacancies at the ISC. Please pass on to anyone suitably<br>qualified who might be interested. Note closing date 26th April<br>for two of the three posts. The ISC's website is at<br>http://www.isc.ac.uk<br><br>Thanks!<br><br>Sheila Peacock, list co-owner. [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-03-09T08:02:25+00:00 2015-03-09T08:02:25+00:00 deadline for AGU award nominations is 15th March https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;80c56471.1503 Dear all,<br><br>15th March (end of this week) is the deadline for nominating<br>people for AGU awards and honorary fellowship.<br><br>See the webpage http://honors.agu.org/awards-medals-prizes/award-search/all-honors/<br><br>We are always delighted when BGA members get AGU awards!<br>Don't hesitate to ask me if you want help preparing a<br>nomination (but don't leave it until Friday 13th because I<br>shall be at RAS Council). [...] Cristian Suteanu 2015-03-06T16:53:35+00:00 2015-03-06T16:53:35+00:00 Digital Earth 2015 - Second Call For Papers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;8450de85.1503 Second Call for Abstracts and Special Sessions<br>9th Symposium of the International Society for Digital Earth<br><br>DIGITAL EARTH 2015 "Towards a One-World Vision for the Blue Planet"<br>Halifax, NS, CANADA, October 5-9<br><br>Digital Earth 2015 seeks abstracts describing the state of the art and practice relating to the five conference themes<http://digitalearth2015.ca/program-themes/>:<br><br>* Digital Earth Theory and Technology [...] Theresa Jung 2015-03-02T10:46:05+00:00 2015-03-02T10:46:05+00:00 Plate tectonics https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;c824869d.1503 Plate tectonics and geophysics<br><br>http://innovative-planetary-science.page.tl/Plate-tectonics.htm<br><br>Regards - Theresa Theresa Jung 2015-03-02T10:33:54+00:00 2015-03-02T10:33:54+00:00 Plate Tectonics https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;6161cab.1503 Plate tectonics:<br><br>http://innovative-planetary-science.page.tl/Plate-tectonics.htm<br><br>Regards - Theresa Ian Main 2015-02-25T10:12:29+00:00 2015-02-25T10:12:29+00:00 Re: Statistical Seismology: job at Edinburgh https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;b0b59b76.1502 Dear all<br><br>We have just extended the deadline for the above post to 16 March 2015.<br>This is a 2-year postdoc position funded as part of the NERC PURE<br>programme (Probability and Uncertainty in Risk Estimation).<br><br>For further information see<br><br>http://www.ed.ac.uk/schools-departments/human-resources/jobs/introduction<br><br>click on 'Academic vacancies'<br><br>click on 'Search Vacancies'<br><br>and select vacancy reference 032591<br><br>Please do pass on the information to suitably-qualified potential<br>candidates. I'd be happy to respond to informal inquiries. [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-02-24T14:41:09+00:00 2015-02-24T14:41:09+00:00 Vote for Christine Peirce in GeolSoc Council Elections https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;585524a3.1502 Dear all,<br><br>those of you who are members of the GeolSoc have the<br>opportunity to vote for new members of its Council.<br>Christine Peirce, formerly Secretary of the British Geophysical<br>Association, is standing for GeolSoc Council, and I encourage<br>you to vote for her. This is partly to build up geophysics representation<br>at the GeolSoc, but mostly because she did a splendid job as BGA Secretary and<br>I expect no less of her as a GeolSoc Council member. She has<br>a GeolSoc award (Coke medal, 2014).<br>http://www.geolsoc.org.uk/About/Awards-Grants-and-Bursaries/Society-Awards/Coke-Medals [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-02-24T14:13:33+00:00 2015-02-24T14:13:33+00:00 Calls for meeting proposals - RAS and GeolSoc https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;39e36b9d.1502 Dear all,<br><br>a reminder that the deadline for proposing "G" (geophysics) discussion<br>meetings for the Royal Astronomical Society is 1st April.<br>See http://www.ras.org.uk/events-and-meetings/ras-meetings/235<br>and contact me if you have an idea for one for the 2015-2016<br>session. Note these are on the second Friday of each month<br>from October to May. See http://www.ras.org.uk/events-and-meetings/ras-meetings<br><br>The Geological Society is now soliciting suggestions for scientific<br>meetings on its 2016 theme, which is based on "water",<br>a subject of interest in many branches of geophysics.<br>See http://www.geolsoc.org.uk/water16<br>There is a link on this page for submitting meeting proposals.<br>If you want to run it [...] Nigel Cassidy 2015-02-20T17:22:26+00:00 2015-02-20T17:22:26+00:00 Places Available : Geophysical Skills Development for Environmental Scientists - NERC Training course for PhD students and Early Career Researchers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;c46f83db.1502 *Last Minute Places Available* - NERC funded "Geophysical Skills<br>Development for Environmental Scientists" Course, March 2015. Keele<br>University, UK.<br><br>Dear Colleagues,<br><br>We have a couple of places that have just become available on the<br>fully-funded, 7-day, residential "Geophysical Skills Development for<br>Environmental Scientists" course running 28th February - 6th march 2015<br>at Keele University, Staffordshire and Grange-over-sands, Cumbria, UK. The meeting will be held in<br>the Royal Astronomical Society lecture theatre at Burlington House<br>(https://www.ras.org.uk/events-and-meetings/ras-meetings) on Friday 13th<br>March 2015.<br><br>Registration will take place at the door, but it would be helpful for<br>planning purposes if anyone intending to attend the meeting could notify<br>Maria Petrunova (mariap@earth.ox.ac.uk). Anyone wishing to present a<br>poster in the lunchtime poster session should email a title and short<br>abstract to barry.parsons@earth.ox.ac.uk [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-02-12T08:08:30+00:00 2015-02-12T08:08:30+00:00 Fwd: Honor Excellence: Call for 2015 AGU Honors Program Nominations https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;dcce9328.1502 Dear all<br><br>Those of you who are AGU members have probably just<br>received this. I'm resending it partly because the first<br>link on the page is broken and should read:<br><br>http://honors.agu.org/awards-medals-prizes/<br><br>and partly because the British Geophysical Association would like<br>its members to win AGU medals and prizes! You can nominate for<br>most of the awards even if you are not an AGU member,<br>but your nominee needs to be one for most of the medals - see [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-02-12T07:55:50+00:00 2015-02-12T07:55:50+00:00 Fwd: New MSc structural geology scholarship for EU students https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;e7a3c4e4.1502 From the Geo-Tectonics list - Leeds University is offering a<br>scholarship for its structural-geology-with-geophysics MSc.<br><br>Sheila Peacock,<br>list co-owner.<br><br>-------- Original Message --------<br>Subject: New MSc structural geology scholarship for EU students<br>Date: Wed, 11 Feb 2015 12:17:30 +0000<br>From: Taija Torvela <T.M.Torvela@LEEDS.AC.UK><br>Reply-To: Tectonics & structural geology discussion list <GEO-TECTONICS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK><br>To: GEO-TECTONICS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br><br>Dear all<br>Apologies for the advertisement but I thought this would benefit your students. We have introduced a new scholarship of \ufffd\ufffd5000 that is available for all EU students that want to take our 1-year MSc Structural Geology with Geophysics course http://www.see.leeds.ac.uk/msc-structure . The scholarship will contribute [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-02-10T17:23:56+00:00 2015-02-10T17:23:56+00:00 Graduate recruitment at RSK - web link https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;d0526235.1502 Further to previous, here is a link directly to RSK's<br>recruitment page.<br><br>Sheila Peacock.<br><br>-------- Original Message --------<br>Subject: RE: Graduate recruitment at RSK<br>Date: Tue, 10 Feb 2015 17:22:05 +0000<br>From: <GTuckwell@rsk.co.uk><br>To: <geophyspeacock@myphone.coop><br><br>Sheila,<br><br>Many thanks,<br><br>Perhaps you could include this link in lieu of the attachments to take people to our recruitment page?<br>https://rsk-careers.icims.com/jobs/1712/graduate-geosciences-scheme-2015/job<br><br>Thanks again,<br><br>George<br><br>Dr George Tuckwell CGeol CSci<br>Director [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-02-10T17:20:52+00:00 2015-02-10T17:20:52+00:00 Graduate recruitment at RSK https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;75fdfbab.1502 Dear all,<br><br>Unique job opportunities, sent on behalf of George Tuckwell, RSK.<br>The original email had attachments, so I have condensed the content of<br>these below. Please refer to www.rsk.co.uk for more<br>details or contact gtuckwell@rsk.co.uk or ring George<br>on +44 (0) 1442 437500.<br><br>Please pass on to anyone you know who might be interested.<br>Note closing date 31st March 2015. [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-02-09T08:49:44+00:00 2015-02-09T08:49:44+00:00 Charles F. Richter Early Career Award Nominations https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;2225698f.1502 Dear all,<br><br>For those who are seismologists and belong to the Seismological<br>Society of America (SSA), and apologies to those who are not: if<br>your early-career friend/colleague/postdoc whom you thought worthy of the<br>RAS Fowler or Winton Capital award didn't get it, then the Richter award<br>is the equivalent from the SSA, for someone within six years<br>of their last academic degree. Both the nominee and the<br>nominators need to be members of the SSA, though. The BGA<br>encourages its members to nominate colleagues for relevant<br>prestigious awards such as this one. [...] Tim Wright [SEE] 2015-01-26T14:56:54+00:00 2015-01-26T14:56:54+00:00 Scientific Programmer for InSAR - Closing Date 31 January https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;566115dd.1501 With apologies for cross postings...<br>---<br>Dear all<br><br>We are currently seeking a Scientific Programmer and InSAR Facility Manager to work at Leeds within COMET and CPOM: http://bit.ly/CInSAR<br><br>I would be grateful if you were able to pass the message on to anyone who you think may be interested. InSAR experience not essential.<br><br>The closing date is 31st Jan 2015. [...] Conall Mac Niocaill 2015-01-26T14:22:47+00:00 2015-01-26T14:22:47+00:00 IUGG session A05: Paleomagnetic reference models, Apparent Polar Wander Paths, and their use in Global and Regional Tectonics https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;c5917931.1501 Dear colleagues,<br><br>Please consider submitting an abstract to IAGA Symposium A05 - "Paleomagnetic reference models, Apparent Polar Wander Paths, and their use in Global and Region Tectonics" of the IUGG meeting in Prague (22 June - 2 July 2015, www.iugg2015prague.com)<br><br>The deadline for abstract submission is 31 January 2015.<br><br>Paleomagnetic reference models, Apparent Polar Wander Paths, and their use in Global and Regional Tectonics (IAGA I-5)<br>Since the construction of the first apparent polar wander (APW) path more than 60 years ago, APW paths have become valuable tools in understanding geodynamics and tectonics on both global and more regional scales. [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-01-21T08:42:55+00:00 2015-01-21T08:42:55+00:00 AGU awards (deadline 15th March) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;d4822154.1501 Dear all,<br><br>It is worth emphasising that British Geophysical Association<br>members, and indeed all the geophysicists on this list,<br>might be candidates for American Geophysical Union<br>awards. The details are on<br><br>http://honors.agu.org/awards-medals-prizes/award-search/all-honors/<br><br>and the deadline is 15th March.<br><br>The AGU has several awards for the communication of<br>geophysics and serving the community, including<br>two for excellence in science journalism and one for<br>communicating climate science. The journalism<br>awards are for "any medium except books" so TV<br>and website articles as well as those in newspapers<br>and magazines would be eligible. [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-01-20T11:42:00+00:00 2015-01-20T11:42:00+00:00 Meeting "From Hooke to Helioseismology", reg d/l 31 Jan https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;f8a2c486.1501 Posted on behalf of Aftab Khan, who had originally attached the<br>programme as a pdf. Since our list doesn't take pdfs (as an aid<br>to low-bandwidth subscribers) I have typed out the speakers' names<br>below. For their affiliations and talk titles do get the full<br>programme from the website.<br><br>Sheila Peacock, list co-owner. George Helffrich 2015-01-17T12:54:46+09:00 2015-01-17T12:54:46+09:00 IUGG JA3 Geophysical Constraints on Geodynamical Processes (IAGA, SEDI, IASPEI, IAVCEI) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;ccbea81.1501 Dear All -<br><br>Some members will likely be interested in this interdisciplinary session. To the others, apologies for the spam.<br><br>The 2015 IUGG General Assembly will be in Prague, Czech Republic at the Prague Congress Centre from June 22-July 2, 2015. Meeting information and abstract submission links can be found at:<br><br>http://www.iugg2015prague.com/scientific-program.htm<br><br>We solicit your abstracts for the JA3 joint association symposium, spanning IAGA, SEDI, IASPEI and IAVCEI. We hope that you can submit an abstract by the January 31, 2015 abstract deadline and join us in Prague this summer.<br>JA3 Geophysical Constraints on Geodynamical Processes (IAGA, SEDI, IASPEI, IAVCEI) [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-01-13T07:58:22+00:00 2015-01-13T07:58:22+00:00 Fwd: I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdm a Geocientist https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;934727ad.1501 Forwarded from geo-tectonics. Geophysicists count, too<br>(see the graphics at the top of the project homepage, http://imageoscientist.eu).<br>And the five "latest questions" from school students include<br>one geophysics question and two that are straight physics!<br><br>Sheila Peacock, list co-owner.<br><br>-------- Original Message --------<br>Subject: I’m a Geocientist<br>Date: Fri, 9 Jan 2015 17:40:44 +0000<br>From: Lao Davila, Daniel <daniel.lao_davila@OKSTATE.EDU><br>Reply-To: Tectonics & structural geology discussion list <GEO-TECTONICS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK><br>To: GEO-TECTONICS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK [...] Jeroen van Hunen 2015-01-12T12:30:50+00:00 2015-01-12T12:30:50+00:00 PhD opportunities at Durham University https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;1304ae.1501 Dear all,<br><br>(Apologies for multiple postings)<br><br>The Earth Sciences department of Durham University, UK<br><http://www.dur.ac.uk/earth.sciences/> invites applications for >30 PhD<br>projects across all Earth Science disciplines. Please see here<br><https://www.dur.ac.uk/earth.sciences/postgraduate/research-programmes/phd-projects/><br>for a list of detailed project descriptions. Funding for several<br>studentships are available through a competitive process from:<br><br>- Durham Doctoral Studentship<br><https://www.dur.ac.uk/science.faculty/postgraduatefunding/#faculty><br>Awards (full awards open to outstanding candidates from the UK, EU and<br>overseas, application deadline: Thursday, 15th January, 2015),<br>- NERC Oil/Gas CDT (full awards open to UK and EU residents, application<br>deadline: Saturday 31st January 2015),<br>- NERC IAPETUS DTP (full awards open to UK residents, [...] Barry Parsons 2015-01-12T12:14:07+00:00 2015-01-12T12:14:07+00:00 Tectonics from Above: RAS 'G' Discussion Meeting 13th March 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;82b474d7.1501 There will be an RAS Discussion Meeting on 'Tectonics from Above: Recent<br>Advances in the Use of High-resolution Topography and Imagery' at<br>Burlington House on Friday 13th March 2015. The topics to be covered at<br>the meeting are outlined below.<br><br>Invited speakers include:<br><br>Jean-Philippe Avouac (University of Cambridge)<br>Thomas Fritz (German Aerospace Centre)<br>Yann Klinger (Institut de Physique du Globe, Paris)<br>Sebastien Leprince (Caltech)<br>Ed Nissen (Colorado School of Mines) [...] Sheila Peacock 2015-01-12T08:27:41+00:00 2015-01-12T08:27:41+00:00 South African Geophysical Association 14th Biennial Conference and Exhibition https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;f848ec50.1501 Dear all,<br><br>I am emailing on behalf of Tshepo David Khoza<br>(david.khoza2@gmail.com) with details of the 14th biennial conference<br>and exhibition of the South African Geophysical Association,<br>which is on 6th to 9th September 2015 at the Champagne Resorts,<br>Drakensberg, South Africa.<br><br>The conference is expected to attract about 300 delegates<br>from academia and industry, and includes talks and<br>workshops on: [...] Kulessa B. 2015-01-11T14:18:07+00:00 2015-01-11T14:18:07+00:00 Deadline extended to 23rd January 2015: Two fully funded peat bog geophysics / environmental reconstruction projects at Swansea University, UK: application deadline 12th January 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;af86a459.1501 Dear all,<br><br>By popular demand we have extended the application deadline for the two studentships to January 23rd - please see my original message below for details.<br><br>Once again, could I please ask you to forward these news to any potential applicants you may know of.<br><br>Many thanks indeed, and best wishes,<br><br>Bernd Sheila Peacock 2015-01-09T12:47:13+00:00 2015-01-09T12:47:13+00:00 Fwd: Call for RAS Specialist Discussion Meetings 2015-16 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;bd418b69.1501 Dear all BGA members,<br><br>This is the annual call for topics/organisers for RAS Specialist<br>Discussion meetings. If you want a specialised discussion meeting<br>on your subject, with funding from the RAS for one or two<br>speakers, and held at Burlington House on the second Friday of<br>a month between October 2015 and May 2016, then follow<br>the instructions below. If you and your co-convenor are GeolSoc BGA members and<br>want to take advantage of this, get in touch with the BGA Committee<br>via me. [...] Jeroen van Hunen 2015-01-08T21:23:27+00:00 2015-01-08T21:23:27+00:00 NERC-funded modelling course: registration information https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;2fc5be55.1501 Dear all,<br><br>This email is to make you aware of a short course on Introducing<br>Numerical Modelling that we are organizing in March 2015 at Durham<br>University. The course is fully funded by NERC (including travel from<br>within the UK to Durham, and local accommodation). This course is aimed<br>at PhD students and young researchers, who are interested in learning<br>the basics about numerical modelling in Earth Sciences. It is open to<br>anyone, but NERC-funded researchers will be given priority. [...] Turbitt, Christopher W. 2015-01-08T10:28:42+00:00 2015-01-08T10:28:42+00:00 British Geological Survey - vacancy https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;a78ff241.1501 Dear colleagues,<br>I would like to bring to your attention a vacancy that we have for a geomagnetic instrumentation/field engineer within the Geomagnetism Team of the British Geological Survey. Details of the post and information on application are available at http://www.topcareer.jobs/Vacancy/irc174693_5019.aspx<br><br>Please note the closing data for applications is the 21st January. [...] Mark Tamisiea 2015-01-07T15:45:27+00:00 2015-01-07T15:45:27+00:00 UK Sea Level Meeting https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;21b2e4e8.1501 Dear All:<br><br>The National Oceanography Centre will be hosting a UK sea level science<br>meeting on 12-13 March 2015 in Liverpool. The meeting, honouring Philip<br>Woodworth upon his retirement, aims to bring together many different<br>facets of sea-level research across the UK science community. The website<br>for the meeting is available at:<br><br>http://noc.ac.uk/conference/uk-sea-level-philip-woodworth<br><br>The programme, registration, and abstract submission pages are available<br>in the menu on the left-hand side of the page. The registration and<br>abstract submission deadline is 30 January. There is no registration fee<br>and lunch will be provided. We will also make reservations at a local<br>restaurant [...] Stephen Daly 2015-01-07T00:05:11+00:00 2015-01-07T00:05:11+00:00 EGU 2015 ERE3.4/TS1.7 Geothermal energy from deep sedimentary basins and their basement https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;d585734.1501 Dear Colleagues and Friends<br><br>This is a final reminder that the deadline for abstract submissions to<br>EGU2015 is fast approaching.<br><br>Please consider submitting an abstract to this session, to which Alan Jones<br>is a confirmed invited speaker.<br><br>ERE3.4/TS1.7 Geothermal energy from deep sedimentary basins and their<br>basement - exploration, exploitation, characterization and modeling<br>(co-organized)<br><br>Convener: Stephen Daly<br>Co-Convener: Barbara Hahne [...] Kulessa B. 2015-01-06T10:46:38+00:00 2015-01-06T10:46:38+00:00 Two fully funded peat bog geophysics / enviromental reconstruction projects at Swansea University, UK: application deadline 12th January 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;267ea320.1501 Dear all,<br><br>With apologies for the short notice (please note the application deadline of 12th January 2015), we have two fully funded integrated peat bog environmental reconstruction / geophysics projects available at Swansea University, UK:<br><br>http://www.swansea.ac.uk/geography/postgraduate/phdopportunitiesandresearchtopics/aninterdisciplinaryassessmentofhumanandclimaticimpactsonholocenepeatbogsinswwales/<br><br>under the umbrella of a project called 'An interdisciplinary assessment of human and climatic impacts on Holocene peat bogs in SW Wales'. [...] Baptie, Brian J. 2015-01-05T15:33:42+00:00 2015-01-05T15:33:42+00:00 Earthquake Seismologist https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEOPHYSICS;fd2d5089.1501 The British Geological Survey (BGS) is one of the world's leading and forward thinking geological science institutes with a focus on both public good science for government and geoscientific research to understand earth and environmental processes. BGS has a long track record of studies of seismic hazard around the world and is recognised internationally as an authority on seismic hazard methodology and associated software development, and has pioneered developments in stochastic modelling (Monte Carlo simulation) for probabilistic seismic hazard, and the use of source model validation techniques.
